packageMeta.name: purescript-halogen
packageMeta.description: A declarative, type-safe UI library for PureScript

declarations.comments: Defer a computation, creating a `Lazy` value.
declarations.title: defer

declarations.comments:
A spec for a parent component, including lifecycle inputs.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `s` is the component's state
- `f` is the query algebra for the component itself
- `g` is the query algebra for child components
- `p` is the slot type for addressing child components
- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: ParentLifecycleComponentSpec

declarations.comments:
A convenience synonym for the output type of a `render` function, for a
parent component that renders HTML.
declarations.title: ParentHTML

declarations.comments:
A synonym for just `HalogenM`. Provided for consistency with `ComponentDSL`
in the non-parent-component case.
declarations.title: ParentDSL

declarations.comments:
A spec for a component.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `s` is the component's state
- `f` is the query algebra for the component itself
- `g` is the query algebra for child components
- `p` is the slot type for addressing child components
- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: ParentComponentSpec

declarations.comments:
A spec for a component with no possible children, including lifecycle
inputs.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `s` is the component's state
- `f` is the query algebra
- `i` is the input value type that will be mapped to an `f` whenever the
      parent of this component renders
- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: LifecycleComponentSpec

declarations.comments:
A spec for a component with no possible children.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `s` is the component's state
- `f` is the query algebra
- `i` is the input value type that will be mapped to an `f` whenever the
      parent of this component renders
- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: ComponentSpec

declarations.comments:
A convenience synonym for the output type of a `render` function, for a
childless component that renders HTML.
declarations.title: ComponentHTML

declarations.comments:
A synonym for `HalogenM` with some type parameters populated that are not
relevant for childless components.
declarations.title: ComponentDSL

declarations.comments:
The "private" type for a component.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `s` is the component's state
- `f` is the query algebra for the component itself
- `g` is the query algebra for child components
- `p` is the slot type for addressing child components
- `i` is the input value type that will be mapped to an `f` whenever the
      parent of this component renders
- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: Component'

declarations.comments:
The "public" type for a component, with details of the component internals
existentially hidden.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `f` is the query algebra
- `i` is the input value type that will be mapped to an `f` whenever the
      parent of this component renders
- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: Component

declarations.comments:
Exposes the inner details of a component to a function to produce a new
result. The inner details will not be allowed to be revealed in the result
of the function - the compiler will complain about an escaped skolem.
declarations.title: unComponent

declarations.comments: Builds a component that allows for children.
declarations.title: parentComponent

declarations.comments:
Makes a `Component` from a `Component'`, existentially hiding details about
the component's state and potential children.
declarations.title: mkComponent

declarations.comments: Builds a component with lifecycle inputs that allows for children.
declarations.title: lifecycleParentComponent

declarations.comments: Builds a component with lifecycle inputs and no possible children.
declarations.title: lifecycleComponent

declarations.comments:
Changes the component's `m` type. A use case for this would be to interpret
some `Free` monad as `Aff` so the component can be used with `runUI`.
declarations.title: hoist

declarations.comments: Builds a component with no possible children.
declarations.title: component

declarations.comments:
A type-safe wrapper for property names.

The phantom type `value` describes the type of value which this property
requires.
declarations.title: PropName

declarations.comments: A wrapper for strings which are used as CSS classes.
declarations.title: ClassName

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for attribute names.
declarations.title: AttrName

declarations.comments:
The status of an `EventSource` subscription. When a query raised by an
`EventSource` evaluates to `Done` the producer will be unsubscribed from.
declarations.title: SubscribeStatus

declarations.comments:
Type synonym for an "request" - a request can cause effects as well as
fetching some information from a component.

In a query algebra, an action is any constructor that carries the algebra's
type variable as the return value of a function. For example:

``` purescript
data Query a = SomeRequest (Boolean -> a)
```
declarations.title: Request

declarations.comments: The Halogen component algebra
declarations.title: HalogenF

declarations.comments:
Type synonym for an "action" - An action only causes effects and has no
result value.

In a query algebra, an action is any constructor that carries the algebra's
type variable as a value. For example:

``` purescript
data Query a
  = SomeAction a
  | SomeOtherAction String a
  | NotAnAction (Boolean -> a)
```

Both `SomeAction` and `SomeOtherAction` have `a` as a value so they are
considered actions, whereas `NotAnAction` has `a` as the result of a
function so is considered to be a "request" ([see below](#Request)).
declarations.title: Action

declarations.comments:
Provides a way of having a component subscribe to an `EventSource` from
within an `Eval` function.
declarations.title: subscribe

declarations.comments:
Takes a data constructor of query algebra `f` and creates a request.

For example:

```purescript
data Query a = GetTickCount (Int -> a)

getTickCount :: forall o eff. HalogenIO Query o (Aff (HalogenEffects eff)) -> Aff (HalogenEffects eff) Int
getTickCount app = app.query (request GetTickCount)
```
declarations.title: request

declarations.comments: Raises an output message for the component.
declarations.title: raise

declarations.comments:
Sends a query to all children of a specific type within a component, using
a `ChildPath` to discriminate the type of child component to query.
declarations.title: queryAll'

declarations.comments: Sends a query to all children of a component.
declarations.title: queryAll

declarations.comments:
Sends a query to a child of a component at the specified slot, using a
`ChildPath` to discriminate the type of child component to query.
declarations.title: query'

declarations.comments: Sends a query to a child of a component at the specified slot.
declarations.title: query

declarations.comments: Set the state.
declarations.title: put

declarations.comments: Modify the state by applying a function to the current state.
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments: Get a value which depends on the current state.
declarations.title: gets

declarations.comments: Get the current state.
declarations.title: get

declarations.comments:
Creates an `EventSource` for a callback that accepts no arguments.

- The first argument is the function that attaches the listener.
- The second argument is the query to raise whenever the listener is
  triggered.
declarations.title: eventSource_

declarations.comments:
Creates an `EventSource` for a callback that accepts one argument.

- The first argument is the function that attaches the listener.
- The second argument is a handler that optionally produces a value in `f`.
declarations.title: eventSource

declarations.comments:
Takes a data constructor of query algebra `f` and creates an action.

For example:

```purescript
data Query a = Tick a

sendTick :: forall o eff. HalogenIO Query o (Aff (HalogenEffects eff)) -> Aff (HalogenEffects eff) Unit
sendTick app = app.query (action Tick)
```
declarations.title: action

modules.name: Halogen
modules.comments:
The base Halogen module re-exports most of the library's useful types and
combinators, aside from the `HTML`-building functionality - the HTML
modules export a large number of commonly named values that are likely to
conflict.

declarations.comments:
A record produced when the root component in a Halogen UI has been run.
`query` allows external sources to query the root component and `subscribe`
allows external consumers to receive messages raised by the root component.
declarations.title: HalogenIO

declarations.comments:
A specialised version of the `Halogen.HTML.Core.HTML` type where `i` is
`* -> *` kinded to match the kind of a component query algebra.
declarations.title: HTML

declarations.comments:
A specialised version of the `Halogen.HTML.Properties.IProp` type where
`i` is `* -> *` kinded to match the kind of a component query algebra.
declarations.title: IProp

declarations.comments:
A record produced when the root component in a Halogen UI has been run.
`query` allows external sources to query the root component and `subscribe`
allows external consumers to receive messages raised by the root component.
declarations.title: HalogenIO

declarations.comments:
A type alias for the basic row of effects involved in running Halogen with
`Aff`-based drivers.
declarations.title: HalogenEffects

declarations.comments: Tries to find an element in the document.
declarations.title: selectElement

declarations.comments:
Runs an `Aff` value of the type commonly used by Halogen components. Any
unhandled errors will be re-thrown as exceptions.
declarations.title: runHalogenAff

declarations.comments: Waits for the document to load.
declarations.title: awaitLoad

declarations.comments: Waits for the document to load and then finds the `body` element.
declarations.title: awaitBody

declarations.comments:
A record produced when the root component in a Halogen UI has been run.
`query` allows external sources to query the root component and `subscribe`
allows external consumers to receive messages raised by the root component.
declarations.title: HalogenIO

declarations.comments:
A type alias for the basic row of effects involved in running Halogen with
`Aff`-based drivers.
declarations.title: HalogenEffects

declarations.comments:
The type used to track a driver's persistent state.

- `h` is the type of value the components produce for rendering.
- `r` is the type for the render state for the driver.
- `s` is the component state type.
- `f` is the projected component query algebra - used for multi-child-type
      components, by projecting to `z` we can avoid the need to remap the
      entire component.
- `z` is the unprojected component query algebra.
- `g` is the component child query algebra.
- `p` is the type of slots for the component.
- `i` is the invput value type.
- `o` is the type of output messages from the component.
- `eff` is the effect row for the target `Aff`
declarations.title: DriverState

declarations.comments:
A version of `DriverState` with the aspects relating to child components
existentially hidden.
declarations.title: DriverStateX

declarations.comments:
A wrapper of `r` from `DriverState` with the aspects relating to child
components existentially hidden.
declarations.title: RenderStateX

declarations.comments:
A type alias for the basic row of effects involved in running Halogen with
`Aff`-based drivers.
declarations.title: HalogenEffects

declarations.comments: Waits for the document to load.
declarations.title: awaitLoad

declarations.comments: Waits for the document to load and then finds the `body` element.
declarations.title: awaitBody

declarations.comments: Tries to find an element in the document.
declarations.title: selectElement

declarations.comments:
Runs an `Aff` value of the type commonly used by Halogen components. Any
unhandled errors will be re-thrown as exceptions.
declarations.title: runHalogenAff

declarations.comments:
The "public" type for a component, with details of the component internals
existentially hidden.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `f` is the query algebra
- `i` is the input value type that will be mapped to an `f` whenever the
      parent of this component renders
- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: Component

declarations.comments:
Makes a `Component` from a `Component'`, existentially hiding details about
the component's state and potential children.
declarations.title: mkComponent

declarations.comments:
Exposes the inner details of a component to a function to produce a new
result. The inner details will not be allowed to be revealed in the result
of the function - the compiler will complain about an escaped skolem.
declarations.title: unComponent

declarations.comments:
The "private" type for a component.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `s` is the component's state
- `f` is the query algebra for the component itself
- `g` is the query algebra for child components
- `p` is the slot type for addressing child components
- `i` is the input value type that will be mapped to an `f` whenever the
      parent of this component renders
- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: Component'

declarations.comments:
A spec for a component with no possible children.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `s` is the component's state
- `f` is the query algebra
- `i` is the input value type that will be mapped to an `f` whenever the

- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: ComponentSpec

declarations.comments:
A convenience synonym for the output type of a `render` function, for a
childless component that renders HTML.
declarations.title: ComponentHTML

declarations.comments:
A synonym for `HalogenM` with some type parameters populated that are not
relevant for childless components.
declarations.title: ComponentDSL

declarations.comments: Builds a component with no possible children.
declarations.title: component

declarations.comments:
A spec for a component with no possible children, including lifecycle
inputs.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `s` is the component's state
- `f` is the query algebra
- `i` is the input value type that will be mapped to an `f` whenever the

- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: LifecycleComponentSpec

declarations.comments: Builds a component with lifecycle inputs and no possible children.
declarations.title: lifecycleComponent

declarations.comments:
A spec for a component.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `s` is the component's state
- `f` is the query algebra for the component itself
- `g` is the query algebra for child components
- `p` is the slot type for addressing child components
- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: ParentComponentSpec

declarations.comments:
A convenience synonym for the output type of a `render` function, for a
parent component that renders HTML.
declarations.title: ParentHTML

declarations.comments:
A synonym for just `HalogenM`. Provided for consistency with `ComponentDSL`
in the non-parent-component case.
declarations.title: ParentDSL

declarations.comments: Builds a component that allows for children.
declarations.title: parentComponent

declarations.comments:
A spec for a parent component, including lifecycle inputs.

- `h` is the type that will be rendered by the component, usually `HTML`
- `s` is the component's state
- `f` is the query algebra for the component itself
- `g` is the query algebra for child components
- `p` is the slot type for addressing child components
- `o` is the type for the component's output messages
- `m` is the monad used for non-component-state effects
declarations.title: ParentLifecycleComponentSpec

declarations.comments: Builds a component with lifecycle inputs that allows for children.
declarations.title: lifecycleParentComponent

declarations.comments:
Changes the component's `m` type. A use case for this would be to interpret
some `Free` monad as `Aff` so the component can be used with `runUI`.
declarations.title: hoist

declarations.comments:
Represents a path through `Either` and `Coproduct` types for the state,
query algebra, and slots of a component. Used when installing children of
different types within a single parent component.
declarations.title: ChildPath

declarations.comments: Composes two paths.
declarations.title: compose

declarations.comments: An identity `ChildPath`.
declarations.title: cpI

declarations.comments: A `ChildPath` that goes to the left.
declarations.title: cpL

declarations.comments: A `ChildPath` that goes to the right.
declarations.title: cpR

declarations.comments:
A `ChildPath` for the 1st component defined using a `Either.Nested` and
`Coproduct.Nested` representation for the sum.
declarations.title: cp1

declarations.comments:
A `ChildPath` for the 2nd component defined using a `Either.Nested` and
`Coproduct.Nested` representation for the sum.
declarations.title: cp2

declarations.comments:
A `ChildPath` for the 3rd component defined using a `Either.Nested` and
`Coproduct.Nested` representation for the sum.
declarations.title: cp3

declarations.comments:
A `ChildPath` for the 4th component defined using a `Either.Nested` and
`Coproduct.Nested` representation for the sum.
declarations.title: cp4

declarations.comments:
A `ChildPath` for the 5th component defined using a `Either.Nested` and
`Coproduct.Nested` representation for the sum.
declarations.title: cp5

declarations.comments:
A `ChildPath` for the 6th component defined using a `Either.Nested` and
`Coproduct.Nested` representation for the sum.
declarations.title: cp6

declarations.comments:
A `ChildPath` for the 7th component defined using a `Either.Nested` and
`Coproduct.Nested` representation for the sum.
declarations.title: cp7

declarations.comments:
A `ChildPath` for the 8th component defined using a `Either.Nested` and
`Coproduct.Nested` representation for the sum.
declarations.title: cp8

declarations.comments:
A `ChildPath` for the 9th component defined using a `Either.Nested` and
`Coproduct.Nested` representation for the sum.
declarations.title: cp9

declarations.comments:
A `ChildPath` for the 10th component defined using a `Either.Nested` and
`Coproduct.Nested` representation for the sum.
declarations.title: cp10

declarations.comments:
Uses a `ChildPath` definition to get a query algebra value of type `f'`
from a value of type `f`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: injQuery

declarations.comments:
Uses a `ChildPath` to attempt to get a query algebra value of type `f`
from a value of type `f'`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: prjQuery

declarations.comments:
Uses a `ChildPath` definition to get a slot value of type `p'` from a
value of type `p`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: injSlot

declarations.comments:
Uses a `ChildPath` definition to get a slot value of type `p'` from a
value of type `p`. Used internally by Halogen.
declarations.title: prjSlot

declarations.comments:
A value carrying its `Ord` instance so it can be used at a later date
without the need for evidence of the instance.
declarations.title: OrdBox

declarations.comments:
A type-safe wrapper for property names.

The phantom type `value` describes the type of value which this property
requires.
declarations.title: PropName

declarations.comments: A wrapper for strings which are used as CSS classes.
declarations.title: ClassName

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for attribute names.
declarations.title: AttrName

declarations.comments: Constructs a text node `HTML` value.
declarations.title: text

declarations.comments: Create an event handler.
declarations.title: handler

declarations.comments: An HTML element that admits children.
declarations.title: Node

declarations.comments: An HTML element that does not admit children.
declarations.title: Leaf

declarations.comments: Creates an HTML element that expects indexed properties.
declarations.title: element

declarations.comments:
The phantom row `r` can be thought of as a context which is synthesized in
the course of constructing a refined HTML expression.
declarations.title: IProp

declarations.comments: Creates an indexed HTML property.
declarations.title: prop

declarations.comments: Creates an indexed HTML attribute.
declarations.title: attr

modules.name: Halogen.HTML
modules.comments:
This module re-exports the types for the `HTML` DSL, and values for all
supported HTML elements.

declarations.comments:
Defines a slot for a child component. Takes:
- the slot "address" value
- the component for the slot
- the input value to pass to the component
- a function mapping outputs from the component to a query in the parent
declarations.title: slot

declarations.comments:
Defines a slot for a child component when a parent has multiple types of
child component. Takes:
- the `ChildPath` for this particular child component type
- the slot "address" value
- the component for the slot
- the input value to pass to the component
- a function mapping outputs from the component to a query in the parent
declarations.title: slot'

declarations.comments:
Attributes, properties, event handlers, and element lifecycles.
Parameterized by the type of handlers outputs.
declarations.title: Prop

declarations.comments: A smart constructor for widget slots in the HTML.
declarations.title: slot

declarations.comments: Constructs a text node `HTML` value.
declarations.title: text

declarations.comments: A smart constructor for HTML elements.
declarations.title: element

declarations.comments: A smart constructor for HTML elements with keyed children.
declarations.title: keyed

declarations.comments: Create a HTML property.
declarations.title: prop

declarations.comments: Create a HTML attribute.
declarations.title: attr

declarations.comments: Create an event handler.
declarations.title: handler

declarations.comments:
A type-safe wrapper for property names.

The phantom type `value` describes the type of value which this property
requires.
declarations.title: PropName

declarations.comments: A type-safe wrapper for attribute names.
declarations.title: AttrName

declarations.comments: A wrapper for strings which are used as CSS classes.
declarations.title: ClassName

declarations.comments: An HTML element that admits children.
declarations.title: Node

declarations.comments: An HTML element that does not admit children.
declarations.title: Leaf

declarations.comments: Creates an HTML element that expects indexed properties.
declarations.title: element

declarations.comments:
Creates an HTML element that expects indexed properties, with keyed
children.
declarations.title: keyed

declarations.comments:
Attaches an event handler which will produce an input when the value of an
input field changes.
declarations.title: onValueChange

declarations.comments:
Attaches an event handler which will produce an input when the seleced index of a
`select` element changes.
declarations.title: onSelectedIndexChange

declarations.comments: Attaches an event handler which will fire on input.
declarations.title: onValueInput

declarations.comments:
Attaches an event handler which will fire when a checkbox is checked or
unchecked.
declarations.title: onChecked

modules.name: Halogen.HTML.Properties
modules.comments:
A closed signature of type-indexed (refined) HTML properties; these can be
used to ensure correctness by construction, and then erased into the
standard unrefined versions.

declarations.comments:
The phantom row `r` can be thought of as a context which is synthesized in
the course of constructing a refined HTML expression.
declarations.title: IProp

declarations.comments: Creates an indexed HTML property.
declarations.title: prop

declarations.comments: Creates an indexed HTML attribute.
declarations.title: attr

declarations.comments:
The `ref` property allows an input to be raised once a `HTMLElement` has
been created or destroyed in the DOM for the element that the property is
attached to.
declarations.title: ref

modules.name: Halogen.HTML.Properties.ARIA
modules.comments: This module provides properties for WAI-ARIA attributes.

declarations.comments: Set the state.
declarations.title: put

declarations.comments: Modify the state by applying a function to the current state.
declarations.title: modify

declarations.comments: Get a value which depends on the current state.
declarations.title: gets

declarations.comments: Get the current state.
declarations.title: get

declarations.comments:
The status of an `EventSource` subscription. When a query raised by an

Creates an `EventSource` for a callback that accepts no arguments.

- The first argument is the function that attaches the listener.
- The second argument is the query to raise whenever the listener is

Creates an `EventSource` for a callback that accepts one argument.

declarations.comments: The Halogen component algebra

Provides a way of having a component subscribe to an `EventSource` from
within an `Eval` function.

declarations.comments: Raises an output message for the component.
declarations.title: raise

modules.name: Halogen.Query
modules.comments:
Functions and types used to describe the `HalogenF` algebra used in a
component's `eval` function.

declarations.comments:
Type synonym for an "action" - An action only causes effects and has no
result value.

In a query algebra, an action is any constructor that carries the algebra's
type variable as a value. For example:

``` purescript
data Query a
  = SomeAction a
  | SomeOtherAction String a
  | NotAnAction (Boolean -> a)
```

Both `SomeAction` and `SomeOtherAction` have `a` as a value so they are
considered actions, whereas `NotAnAction` has `a` as the result of a
function so is considered to be a "request" ([see below](#Request)).
declarations.title: Action

declarations.comments:
Takes a data constructor of query algebra `f` and creates an action.

For example:

```purescript
data Query a = Tick a

sendTick :: forall o eff. HalogenIO Query o (Aff (HalogenEffects eff)) -> Aff (HalogenEffects eff) Unit
sendTick app = app.query (action Tick)
```
declarations.title: action

declarations.comments:
Type synonym for an "request" - a request can cause effects as well as
fetching some information from a component.

In a query algebra, an action is any constructor that carries the algebra's
type variable as the return value of a function. For example:

``` purescript
data Query a = SomeRequest (Boolean -> a)
```
declarations.title: Request

declarations.comments:
Takes a data constructor of query algebra `f` and creates a request.

For example:

```purescript
data Query a = GetTickCount (Int -> a)

getTickCount :: forall o eff. HalogenIO Query o (Aff (HalogenEffects eff)) -> Aff (HalogenEffects eff) Int
getTickCount app = app.query (request GetTickCount)
```
declarations.title: request

declarations.comments: Sends a query to a child of a component at the specified slot.
declarations.title: query

declarations.comments:
Sends a query to a child of a component at the specified slot, using a
`ChildPath` to discriminate the type of child component to query.
declarations.title: query'

declarations.comments: Sends a query to all children of a component.
declarations.title: queryAll

declarations.comments:
Sends a query to all children of a specific type within a component, using
a `ChildPath` to discriminate the type of child component to query.
declarations.title: queryAll'

declarations.comments:
The status of an `EventSource` subscription. When a query raised by an
`EventSource` evaluates to `Done` the producer will be unsubscribed from.
declarations.title: SubscribeStatus

declarations.comments:
Creates an `EventSource` for a callback that accepts one argument.

- The first argument is the function that attaches the listener.
- The second argument is a handler that optionally produces a value in `f`.
declarations.title: eventSource

declarations.comments:
Similar to `eventSource` but allows the attachment function to return an
action to perform when the handler is detached.
declarations.title: eventSource'

declarations.comments:
Creates an `EventSource` for a callback that accepts no arguments.

- The first argument is the function that attaches the listener.
- The second argument is the query to raise whenever the listener is
  triggered.
declarations.title: eventSource_

declarations.comments:
Similar to `eventSource_` but allows the attachment function to return an
action to perform when the handler is detached.
declarations.title: eventSource_'

declarations.comments:
Takes a producer of `Maybe`s and filters out the `Nothings`. Useful for
constructing `EventSource`s for producers that don't need to handle every
event.
declarations.title: catMaybes

declarations.comments: The Halogen component algebra
declarations.title: HalogenF

declarations.comments:
Provides a way of having a component subscribe to an `EventSource` from
within an `Eval` function.
declarations.title: subscribe

declarations.comments: Raises an output message for the component.
declarations.title: raise

declarations.comments:
A record produced when the root component in a Halogen UI has been run.
`query` allows external sources to query the root component and `subscribe`
allows external consumers to receive messages raised by the root component.
declarations.title: HalogenIO
